column4: hello folks, I've discovered that in every shell I open the http_proxy enviroment variable is automatically set with an IP:PORT... I've never added that variable neither configured a main proxy for the OS... is there any conffile in /etc to disable this enviroment variable? thanks
[Is it possible ti could be a BUG, or a malicious software?]
you probably installed a package that set it.  Check /etc/environment maybe
no, it /etc/enviroment only PATH: is setted up
